Randy's relationship with Ashley and her thickening waistline may have caught the eye of Ashley's classmates and especially her cheerleading squad teammates, but to them it was of little concern. For Ashley's mother, who had never been slender herself and retained cruel memories of what that could mean, it was a different matter. This was especially so since Ashley seemed to her to be in denial that there was even a problem.

“Roger, we need to talk,” Rona Morton said to her husband.

“That’s not usually a difficult task for us” he replied.lightly before assuming a look of more serious concern. “What you really mean is, there’s a problem and you think I’m not paying it adequate attention.”

“Well, not entirely. I’m sure you are very well aware. You’ve never hesitated to have your hands over the rolls and collops of my body any chance you get,”

Roger grinned broadly “well, i do have this license that says i have permission to do just that! But where is this going?”

“Alright, I’ll not be coy. Genes or not, don’t you think Ashley is starting to take after her mom a bit early? She’s only 18!” Rona blurted out in a rush.

“And heading up the cheerleading team with a boyfriend who seems to love every ounce? Oh yes, a walking dirigible – maybe we should contact Goodyear for a surplus hanger?” her father said with obvious exaggeration

“Roger – please try and be serious about this. I’ve tried talking to her and she just blows me off like its no big deal.” Rona said with an edge in her voice.

Mr. Morton reacted sanguinely. “Perhaps it isn’t? Think about that for a moment. Our daughter has a pretty good brain and her grades show it. I think she triangulated that Kim quite nicely. She could have thrown a hissy fit over things and sulked all year. Instead she just stayed on the team and bided her time.”

“Just like her political minded Dad suggested and OK, you win a point on that one. But it doesn’t it bother you that all holiday season she was having seconds on everything sight? The she chooses lemon cake slices over melons for after school snacks? And now polishes off any leftovers with Randy after school as a matter of routine?”

“Is Randy bothered?” Roger replied.

“Anything but!” Rona declared. “I’ve even heard him ask if she wants him to warm them up without her having mentioned it. Then he has some but she usually winds up with more. He’s an absolute enabler – and I know you know exactly what that term means.”

“Yes, but I’ve never enabled anyone against their will and you know that’s true, right? So what you’re saying is that instead of being bothered he seems to be encouraging and may be turned on by her appetite? Just like another couple I seem to remember,” he grinned and reminisced.

“We were in college when all that started, and I was beyond having to worry about high school peer pressure. And I wasn’t ever a cheerleader anyway.’ Rona reminded her husband.

“Nope, in high school you were already lovely and well beyond where Ashley is. I’ve seen the pictures and only wish ‘d known you then – you’d have had the dates others got, believe me. Apparently the apple doesn’t fall too far from the tree. And you’re right – I’m not creating the situation but I’m not disturbed by it at all. Ashley doesn’t have your problem. Randy’s a nice young man – you have to give him that. So what happens if you make all the goodies go poof, including leftovers?”

“I’ve tried that,” Mrs. Morton sighed resignedly. “They just bring in fast food. Randy’s got enough money that he can take her to a restaurant whenever he wants – and has been. ’

“And talking to her directly has resulted in?” Mr. Morton inquired.

“’Mom, don’t worry. Everything’s ok’ – or words to that effect.” sighed her mom.

“So if she doesn’t want any help and we can’t control matters, what’s the issue? Your transference a bit perhaps?” Roger asked.

“Honestly, I don’t know – but maybe you could talk to her and at least find out more of what’s going on. I don’t think I have the whole picture – I just know she’s getting fatter by the week.” Rona lamented.

“Ok, but don’t expect me to push for anything. I think she’s fine. Tomorrow night after supper leave the dessert out and disappear. I’ll take it from there,” Mr Morton offered

The next evening dessert was a freshly thawed Boston crème pie. For all her conscious concern about Ashley the Morton household had nerver been low calorie. Rona Morton cut three pieces and taking one for herself and then said, “if you’ll excuse me I need to make some phone calls.”

“OK mom – and the linguine tonight was delicious!”: chirped Ashley.

“Thank you dear. I noticed you couldn’t resist seconds,” she gibed a bit as she left.

Ashley looked at her father and rolled her eyes. “I wish mom would stop worrying. I know I’ve gained weight – and eating stuff like linguini and this pie isn’t going to lose any. Why can’t she understand that maybe that’s not the game plan?

Roger Morton smiled, “well, that’s quite a statement. You mean there’s a plan?”

“Yes – first I like being a bit more curvy. Second so does Randy and third it solidifies my position vis a vis Kim.” Ashley declared

“Oh? Why?” asked Mr. Morton

Ashley took a deep breath and cut loose. “She’s a diet Nazi who loves to bully others over their weight but has now picked up a few herself, as have the others on the team. If we stay bigger and she is too but we’re still popular with the fans she is neutralized, not able to intimidate us like she used to if she comes back – which may be never. .”

“Whoa, who came up with all that mouthful?” her dad exclaimed/

“It sort of emerged collectively daddy. You really like mom heavier, don’t you? Well there are guys who feel the same way at my age and its being expressed a lot more openly nowadays. You can like and date and be who you like. Our team is a statement that chunky equals cute – after all, we are the Boars, wherever that school nickname came from!”

Mr. Morton backed up a country mile upon hearing the school’s nickname before replying. “You should ask your friend and teammate Rosa – her grandparents and my parents were involved in that decision you’ll find out fascinating; some people still hate us for our part, but we and Rosa’s clan stood on the same side.”

“What are you talking about?” Ashley inquired, puzzled that the subject seemed to have suddenly shifted. It was unlike her father to lose focus so easily but something obviously had affected him.

“Another time – but talk with Rosa first. Right now there are two pieces of Boston crème pie left. I’m kind of hankering to have one. The issue, is what about you?”

“Umm, I take it there was a sub-agenda reason why mom left the room?”

“Yes, I’m supposed to find out what’s going on with you and the way you’ve been eating. I think you’ve already answered that question. What I'm curious about is whether you feel guilty about wanting another piece of that pie or are you happy that I’m suggesting we share?’

“Pass your plate and pick which one you want; I’ll take the other.” she smiled. “Does that answer your question about my guilt feelings? Hopefully you can reassure mom!”

Father and chubby daughter happily finished their treat, each feeling more secure in their relationships with the other.

-------

The next day after practice Ashley offered Rosa a ride home

“I’d like to buy us some ice cream, we need to talk,” she said.

Rosa, always willing to have an ice cream treat, accepted with a little apprehension. Ashley had reinstated her to the team and since then treated her nicely, but always in a group setting, not one-on-one.

After ordering a couple of sundaes Ashley quickly came to the point, ”My dad says his father and your grandfather had something to do with the school team being called the Boars and that i should get the full story from you. Any idea what he is talking about?”

Rosa looked at Ashley with a strange wistful expression, pools of tears welling up in her eyes.

Biting her lip she closed her eyes and responded, “Your grandfather was a good man – one of the few who tried to stand up against the stupidity. When all else failed they forced the Boars name on the stupid PC crowd who wouldn’t let them keep the original..”

“What are you talking about?” Ashley said, totally bewildered.

“My grandfather and your grandfather were on the school football team when it was called the Apaches fifty five or so years ago. They were friends, very close. As you know many Mexicans, including myself, have Indian blood in our veins. We felt the Apache name reflected that heritage, even though our tribal ties are different, and your grandfather agreed.

“Some years after they had graduated it was no longer politically correct to name teams after Indians anymore. The state authorities passed down a ruling requiring teams to change their name. The school authorities here didn’t want to fight it – “too costly” they said. That’s when our grandfathers tried to step in. Your grandfather supplied money for lawyers and the campaign; mine marshaled the manpower. Your grandfather was called a traitor to his class, accused of being a supporter of racism racist and worse – but it was all a lie! It was my people who were the proud ones, defending our heritage and he was standing with us.

Al this was news to Ashley. But she immediately empathized with the view of her grandfather. “ Uh, you say it failed?”

Rosa nodded her head. “Yes. The local politicians didn’t want to take on the state and wouldn’t lend the school district’s name to a lawsuit even if was free to them. It could cause too many other problems they felt. Never mind that 2000 alumni wanted to retain Apaches. But they did agree to let the student body vote on what the new name should be.. So my people proposed and the student body chose the boar name – it meant that the children of all those who forced us to give up the name Apaches would graduate as wild pigs. And although few graduating know the meaning, the ones who forced it down our throats know. Some I am sure still hate your family for its role.”

Ashley bowed her head. “We’re not like by a lot of people for all kinds of stuff Rosa, most of it just envy, because in truth, as far as i know, like with your Grandpa, we’ve mostly used our money to help others.

Rosa reached over and touched Ashley’s hand. “I know that Ashley. You’ve always treated me nicely. You’ve never made remarks about my clothes not being as fancy as yours or consider me too poor to talk with. My mother and her friends work in many homes. We know many things, Yours is not one who has a bad reputation. You pay fairly and treat others justly.”

“Thanks Rosa. You have no idea how that touches me,” Ashley replied. “Having money your born into isn’t my fault, but with it goes a responsibility to use it wisely and not condescend to others. /It can go away and be lost – it doesn’t make anyone any better or less for having or not having. I’ve bee taught that.

Rosa spoke kindly. “We have a saying that my mom uses at times – when we leave this earth we all take the same things and the coffins aren’t that different,”

“True,” agreed Ashley as they got ready to leave.

“And thanks for the sundae,” Rosa noted.

“Anytime,” smiled Ashley.

- - - -

Randy Waring’s family was of the same social strata as the Mortons. Their money wasn’t nearly as old or as much, but as Ashley shared with him Rosa’s revelations Randy understood what she was getting at..

“Well, that accounts for a few things, he exclaimed.

“How so?” she said.

“The way the selection for cheerleader was rigged to get Kim in- rumor has had it it was directed as payback at your family, it had nothing to do with you. Or your comparative ability” he declared.

Ashley agreed. “I’ve known that Randy, but thought it was over other issues.”

“I’m sure it’s a package, but it’s the same people – i just wish there was a way to give them payback,” he grumbled angrily.

“You have an idea?” she said.

“Not immediately – but give me a few days,” he replied.

He liked her curves as much as she did, There was a double purpose to his exhibiting his culinary skills to her and her family – he didn’t want her even thinking of diets.

“Big chance of that.” thought Amber. She knew anorexics saw themselves as fat even when they weighed less than a hundred and were fearful of eating anything. Bulimics compensated by stuffing and purging. She knew she was just the opposite. “I’m, just going to be my own person –and f I ever get too big for Kim then bye bye cheerleading,” she finally decided. The next day, as a deliberate gesture of defiance, she and Kevin had a high calories entrée and dessert within eyesight of a fuming Kimberly.

“I am the captain and I set the rules,” she stormed.

Kimberly sensed that Amber was spoiling for a fight and feared that she might win. She’d obviously been doing factual homework that the intellectually lazy Kim hadn’t. The fact was that Amber was excellent in all her routines and had been a junior varsity squad heads who probably had ambitions for Kimberly’s job the coming year. Unlike the more phlegmatic and less skilled Rosa she might fight and win if pushed too hard. Kim backed down, swinging her head and saying “you’d better decide to do what I’ve told you or you could be sorry. That’s all I’m saying for now.”

With that Kimberly stormed off, leaving Rosa and Ashley amazed.

“wow, you really took the queen bee to task,” Rosa said

“Well I’m no drone in her hive,” snapped Amber.

“Look,” confided Ashley, “I know we’ve not bee lose, but for what its worth I’m sorru you had to put up with that crap and thankful you spoke up. OK?”

That evening as she and her family enjoyed the chicken marsala dinner he had prepared her parents also swore to back her up.

“Now I was at every Junior Varsity game you ever performed in – I knew your skills. But you’re partly right, I had been impressed by you as a person before I even knew you were on the squad. Amber’s parents were amazed at the seemingly casual but obviously well thought out calculations of Amber’s boyfriend.

“What would happen if the ASB ran the cafeteria…”

Unlike some of her teammates Trixie never wanted diva power, dominating and controlling others. She just wanted recognition. A latchkey kid living with a weight conscious aunt absorbed with a civil service career, recognition in her mind equated to keeping a tight belly with constant workouts and eating as little as possible. This and a big bust, she thought, was the best way to get guys. And getting guys was the real reason she was on the cheerleading squad.

Only it hadn’t worked out that way. She’d seen Kimberly bounce Ashley as Captain, only to have Ashley acquire a boyfriend and about twenty pounds as she uncovered Kimberly's deception and bounced back on top. Amber had gained even more and had a nice guy too. And the deposed Kimberly was gaining so much that rumor had it she wasn’t even coming back, but she still had a boyfriend as well.

Trixie had no one, and rather than exercising so obsessively she secretly wished she could eat like her more porky teammates. . But instead of eating burritos or lasagna for lunch she stuck to her salads and squelched her envy. After all, no one was keeping her from having a cheeseburger if she wanted to. She was just better than that.

Or was she? Could she give herself permission to go against her aut’s injunctions and have some ice cream?

One afternoon in early November she caved in and bought a pint of Ben and Jerry’s, devouring it in the park before discarding the evidence in a public waste basket. It had been divine.

“So that’s what its like,” she thought.

The next day she skipped over the salads and bought a couple of grilled cheese sandwiches. Again she enjoyed the flavors. Nervously that afternoon she explored her belly, then got on a scale to explore the damage. She couldn’t find any.

“Wow,” she thought” Ie been depriving myself for nothing. My metabolism apparently can handle this.”

That weekend at a Saturday night party she allowed herself to have here pieces of pizza for the first time in her life, and it felt good. The next day she had a grande burrito and taco bell. Feeling guilty, she again checked the scale. Still no damage.

And so as Thanksgiving approached Trixie relaxed her guard, trusting her metabolism to let her eat like she wished. It took nearly two months and the Xmas holidays before she really began to notice the slow changes in her body. A pair of her jeans seemed tighter and there was a softness in her midriff.

“Whoa, am I developing a pot belly?” she asked herself, resolving to exercise and cut back. But of course it didn’t happen. She knew her aunt wasn’t really watching, the Cheerleading squad didn’t care, and she was getting now attention from guys that she hadn’t had before. Had she been more discerning she would have been able to see that it wasn’t her relaxed attitude towards food that was actually drawing the guys. What she had was a more happy disposition. But such nuances of understanding weren’t in her mental computer and her lifestyle change continued.

As the cheerleading session ended so did Trixie’s workouts. This left more time for socializing and eating and by March a doughiness was developing around her midriff but she didn’t care. She knew she’d gained. Her pink and green tube tops were tight in the tummy and by April were requiring her to wear an overblouse to hide budding love handles. She’d also had to stop wearing both of her pencil skirts and her panties and bra were leaving red marks.

In class she was aware that her tummy was ballooning over her waistband and she needed to be sure to keep it covered. By May she was enjoying snacks with her homework and buttery muffins for breakfast in he morning. Other things were starting her day as well. Everything told her that indulging in starchy breakfasts of waffles with strawberries and whipped cream along with snacks for six months had added some weight. She was finding the tightness of her clothes secretly exciting – and was amazed that her aunt wasn’t even noticing. When she looked in the mirror she saw not a fat girl but one who actually had a shape.

The next Monday school would be resuming after the holidays and Aunt Rachel would leave the Saturday before with Trixie at Mrs. Woods. The mystery of the bogus emails remained unresolved but with the passing of the holidays Erica had let it slip from her memory. She had time alone by herself to fill her way - and that meant filling the bellies of herself and her boyfriend..

-------

That Monday Erica stood in her room in Louise Wood’s house, contemplating her slightly pudgy cheeks. The face looking back at her had slight dimples and a bit of fleshiness beneath her chin. She bit her lip, thinking that she looked cute and wondering what her school coaches and aunt would do if they knew what she was contemplating – a month of good food and rich desserts. .

After seeing her Aunt off at the airport with Mrs. Woods on Saturday night the slightly stout host had taken Erica home and shown her the room that would be hers. Then she asked when Erica would like to get up on Sunday morning, saying “I’d like to offer you a welcoming breakfast – but don’t know if you’ll mind. Is your appetite good?”

“Oh I’m a cheerleader and swimmer, Mrs. Woods, so I’m not dieting or anything. I get plenty of exercise. II don’t want to impose, but I’m sure I’ll be ready for any breakfast you make,” she’d replied.

On Sunday morning Mrs. Woods prepared an apple pancake breakfast with scrambled eggs and beef patties, It was easily 30% larger than what Aunt Rachel would have done, Erica thought as she poured syrup onto her stack of three pancakes, “So this is what Auntie was expecting. Well, I’m going to be a good guest!”

“Now this afternoon I have a friend, Leilani, coming in from out of town. You don’t have to come to supper with us if you don’t want to, but we’re going to the Old Spaghetti Factory. Do you want to come along?”

“Well, sure. That place is classic,” answered Erica. She knew about the place, housed in a renovated streetcar terminal, with some of the booths inside the shells of ld cars, but had never been there. This was definitely something her weight-conscious Aunt Rachel wouldn’t be doing.

That night she met Leilani, a large Hawaiian woman weighing well over 200 pounds. Both she and Louise turned out to have good appetites and as their guest Erica followed suit, dining on a stomach-stretching Caesar salad, bread with butter, and the spaghetti with rich meat sauce. Knowing she was at healthy weight Erica didn’t even consider calories, thinking only “yummy! This is great.”

That was still her attitude on Monday as she adjusted her outfit an prepared for breakfast – which for her typically meant some melons, a bowl of cereal and a piece of toast. But that was with her Aunt, not Mrs., Woods.

“Good morning Erika, I hear you. Breakfast will be ready shortly,” she called as soon as Erica opened her bedroom door enroute to the bath.

“Oh? What are we having?”

“Muffins and quiche – I hope you enjoy it,” came he reply.

“Uh, OK, great. I’ll be there in about ten” Erica said.

“What is quiche?” she wondered. She had never had the dish, but soon found out that it was an egg-based custard like filling in a shell similar to pie crust – ingredients flexible. It was luscious, and Erica had two large pieces. She also saw the potential.

“These are excellent!,” she declared as Mrs. Woods smiled. “Could you teach me to make them? I have a little project …”

She explained to Mrs. Woods her intention to make dishes for herself and Don with the hope of helping him add a few pounds to his lanky frame. Mrs. Woods gladly offered to help in any way she could,

Erica already had her Monday meal for Don planned. She had him snack on Doritos with melted cheese while she prepared entrees of pasta and chicken for upper, then serve ice cram for dessert. Don enjoyed the attention and even allowed himself to be plied with seconds with his portion being larger. Of course before times Erica normally had never had seconds at all, so what she was getting was also extra.

Louise had told Erica that a neighbor had invited her to do a dessert for a bar-b-q on Wednesday and that she and Don would be welcome. Don readily accepted the invitation on that night they both enjoyed a grilled Portobello Mushroom on the BBQ with some Balsamic Vinegar and melted cheddar cheese. along with a burger, potato salad, fries and a couple of cokes. Then they brought out dessert – a pineapple upside down cake.

“Boy, you are doing your best to get me eating more,” Don remarked.

“I promised. Aren’t you enjoying it?”

“Well, honestly, yeah,” he agreed, noting to himself that Erika was sating pretty well herself. Don actually hated being skinny, but had never gained weight readily, so he appreciated the extra effort.

“This b-b-q is great – but have you ever eaten at Oscar’s Roadhouse?”

“No – what’s that?”

“A fifty’s like place where they serve you exotic burgers in an old car hub-cap – although really the one hey use for a plate wasn’t ever used for that. Want to go Saturday night?”

“Why not?” Erica agreed

And so it was that on Saturday she and Don were each devouring anaheim pepper chicken burgers with cheese and hebero mayo, served along with the obligatory baked beans, cold slaw and sweet potato fries, quaffed down with a bottomless raspberry teas.

Mrs. Adams meanwhile had been introducing Erica to new things to try on Don, which of course meant that Erica had them too. She trued to make sure that he always had more and generally succeeded. However, her own penchant for candy bar snacks at school and the ample breakfasts from Mrs. Adams made up for any shortfall.
.
The third weekend Mrs. Adams invited both Erica and Don to a wedding reception at her church. Who could resist? Well, certainly not Erica, who by now had an appetite eager to explore new vistas. After all, how many receptions does one attend in a year? Nor don, who had never dreamed a pretty girl like Erica would do so much with him.

She quickly found out it was more like a brunch, some deep fried eggrolls filled with meat, chicken with ricotta cheese and gravy over rice pilaf... But her favorite part was the chocolate mousse. Erica had never had mousse before and she told Don “it was one of the most amazing things I've ever eaten. I thought it was ice cream at first. Then, duh, I should have noticed they were serving it to nearly 80 people and it wasn't melting.”

“You do realize we just crashed a reception where neither of us knew either the bride or groom?” Don asked as they went home.

“I know – but Mrs. Adams said 80% of the people were there from the bride’s side. By sorting with the groom’s side of the aisle it balanced things out. They don’t know we’re not related to someone who attends there every week. Wasn’t the food great?”

“Yeah, that it was,” marveled Don. It seemed as though Erika was utterly shameless in her efforts to get him to eat. Thing was, he was enjoying it and his pants were tighter. He’d had to let out his belt a notch.

It was now the fourth and final week before her Aunt’s return. Knowing that all good things might soon becoming to an end she went on a splurge fit, taking Don with her. There was another B-B-Q invitation, Three pieces of grilled chicken along with rice and salad plus two kinds of pie and a cake for dessert found their way to her gullet. Then the next evening she and Don hit up a Chinese restaurant (Don’s treat) and on the next two days had fast food fests at Taco Bell and Desert Queen (courtesy of Erica).

As they waited with Louise at the airport Don confided to his girlfriend that her efforts had been successful – he now weighed 122 pounds, meaning he’d put o seven in one month. Erika smiled and said she didn’t know hers and wasn’t going to look, but they both knew she had probably gained some as well. Louise planned on taking everyone out to supper and they were both ready for dessert.

152211.content:
Rachel returned on schedule Friday evening, tired but pleased at the success of her month log assignment. She gratefully accepted Louise’s hospitality and made no remarks as Erica and Don ordered hearty steak and potato meals, then had sundaes for dessert. They were obviously still in a happy relationship and she knew better than to interfere. Erica went home with her Aunt Rachel, thanking Louise for her month of hospitality.

Rachel gave her niece a good night hug, not failing o notice the soft mess of her niece’s flesh, but held her peace and retired to her room. Erica was pleasantly surprised.

The next morning Erica preened herself in front of her mirror, donning a size 8 bikini that had been fine at 130 pounds but which was now definitely snug and was too thin to properly contain her belly. Her top was also too small, as the cups could scarcely contain her expanded breasts..

“So far so good, but I’d better get one bigger – can’t have Aunt Rachel seeing me bursting out of this,” she observed. Her thighs were getting noticeably bigger as well. As she got ready for breakfast she decided to wear loose fitting clothes so as not to attract undue attention from her Aunt.

The strategy worked. Rachel slept in, affording Erica a chance to make s jalapeño and cheese quiche as a surprise. She served it with a quarter cantaloupe to her aunt, who complimented her on her developing cooking skills.

“Very good.” she exclaimed. “Is this the kind of thing you’ve been feeding Don?

“Well, once so far. But actually this is the kind of thing Mrs. Adams does. Would you like to have this kind of breakfast here during the week? I could make it for you?”

The truth was that Erica didn’t want to give up the type of flare she had been enjoying.

“On special occasions perhaps – but not regularly. I can assure you I’d gain weight rapidly, much more than a young person like you, if I regularly ate like this.

During the day Erika went shopping, picking up a size 12 Bikini styled after her size 8. After a burrito combo in the food court she headed home for nap before Don picked her up for a Chinese buffet,

At the buffet she had three plates, including some deep fried eggrolls filled with meat, chicken with ricotta cheese and gravy over rice, sweet and sour chicken and honey walnut prawns.

Sunday morning Rachel surprised Erica with a small stack of waffles and some scrambled eggs. It was only half the breakfast she’d become used to, but her niece was appreciative of the effort.

“At least she’s not lecturing me about how I need to diet,” she thought.

That day she and Don went o a concert in the park and Rachel told her niece to bring him home for supper. There she had prepared a green bean casserole with chicken. Both Don and Erika had generous portions, and Don openly discussed Erica’s cooking and its impact on his waistline. As he bragged abut her abilities with strata casserole it confirmed the success of the effort of whist was being attempted. What surprised her was that he was totally aware and supportive of it.

Don showed the better appetite, but then went a step extra in asking about dessert.

“Oh, I’m, sorry – I don’t normally do that,” replied Rachel

“That’s OK, answered Don, recognizing his faux paux.

“Oh, perhaps you two might just go some place and have something by yourselves,” Aunt Rachel graciously replied. An hour or so later they did just that,

Upon returning Erica wondered what her Aunt might say. Predictably she was up enjoying television, but hit the mute button as Erica started for her room.

“Have a moment, sweetie?” she asked.

“Oh, sure,” she said, conscious that her belly was absolutely bulging from a banana split and burger combo freshly eaten on top of supper.

“Exactly what is a strata casserole?” she asked, hearkening back to the dish Don had bragged about at supper. .

“Several ingredients layered on top of one another in a casserole dish – like sliced potatoes with eggs and salmon in between. Its another thing I learned from Mrs. Adams,” Erica replied.

“It seems I overlooked your aptitude for the kitchen in raising you,” Rachel said. ”The truth is, I never mastered such things myself and it didn’t occur to me in this age that someone like you would be interested in what ovens were used for ‘cause my generation thought they were old fashioned already.”

“Things today are convenient but have so many preservatives, Aunt Rachel. People my age are concerned a lot about getting back to older ways. Did you know that even fresh tomatoes in the produce aisle only have 1/8th the nutrition value as they did a hundred years ago/ A lot of people are actually starting to grew their own!”

Rachel was stunned. She hadn’t expected a home economics lecture.

“Hmm, well would you like to set aside the area behind the garage to grow veggies and do some cooking for me as well? I’ve never had a strata casserole and it sounds like I need to get with the program?”

Startled, Erica realized tat her Aunt had strangely shifted from her position rejecting such an idea earlier in the evening. “Well, uh, sure. But if you gain a few pounds like Don has please don’t fuss,”

“Young lady, be merciful to an older woman. I’m trying not to fuss over the way you’re filling out, so give me a break. Alright?”

“Yes Auntie,” Erica said contritely as she bent over and hugged her Aunt.

“And one other thing. What about supper – do you think you could delay things a bit and include me on occasion? You don’t really need to split your supper into two meals just to act like you’re barely easting. You have better use for your Social Security benefits I’m sure.”

Erica winced. “I take it I didn’t cover my tracks very well?”

“I’m gone four weeks and what I had for a spice collection is way down – and then there are ones I never use. That told me some heavy duty cooking has happened even if you did throw out the garbage.” Aunt Rachel declared, and then smiled.

“Actually I should be proud of you for carrying through on your little project; he does need some meat on his bones and you’re doing it up front. And as for you, well, its your body, so if you don’t mind I guess I shouldn’t.”

“Auntie, I’m still a cheerleader and on the swim team – its not like I’m really getting huge!”

“No, not at all – at least not yet. But what I see coming in time will just have to be. You seem happy enough and I’m now resolved that I’m going to enjoy your efforts. OK?”

“Alright, Auntie – now can I go to bed? Its after eleven?”

“Certainly – sweet dreams.”

In her room Erica disrobed and sat on her bed, fondling her distended belly and looking at her once thin arms, now featuring a slight roundness. Heavy exercise or not, she was getting plumper. She knew what her aunt was alluding to, bit like the others n the Boar high School squad the fact was that she rather liked her more Ruebenesque figure.

‘When I get over 160 I’ll start counting calories,” she resolved, “but I’ll have graduated by then Right now Don is project #1 and I can’t be distracted.”

She sent him a text message thanking him for a great night and the ice cream – then clicked off the light.

- - - -

The next Sunday Don and Erica started the garden and worked out a menu for the next week, including two supper meals with Rachel. Tuesdays was pot-roast with baked potato and asparagus plus lemon meringue pudding for dessert. Thursday was a tuna casserole wit a dessert of apple pie. Admittedly some of the veggies, especially the ones in the salads, were coming from Louise Adam’s garden as the one Erica and Don had started wasn’t producing yet, But she had to admit they looked and tasted better.

Meanwhile Erica made breakfasts on Monday, Wednesday and Friday. Monday was poached eggs with corned beef hash, Wednesday was a salmon strata and Thursday was waffles with strawberries and melon. Aunt Rachel, who fully realized the calories involved much more than Erica, still found herself looking forward to the next surprise, which truly surprised her.

Rachel picked up on something else as well. Don was openly happy about his own gaining and his part in working on the garden while Erica cooked. But he seemed equally happy to watch Erica and Rachel enjoy their food. She began to wonder if there wasn’t a dual dynamic at work here.

“If so, I’ll let it ride,” she thought. “Its only for a few months,”

1522112.content:
Chapter next

As February came so did first semester grades. Erica had three A’s and 2 B’ – her best ever in High School. She attributed it to her studying with Don – which was definitely a factor. Of course they had been eating together as well, so to celebrate they naturally turned to food, in this case a moderately expensive restaurant called Tony Romas.

Now Tony’s is known for its beef and pork ribs, but it also has chicken, steak and fish. This evening, after an appetizer of baked potato soup, they had some great fish specials. Erica had pan-seared sesame crust Mahi Mahi while Don ordered Norwegian salmon. Both came with rice and vegetables.

It had now been over a month since the last of the mysterious pranks, but Trixie, aka Erica, hadn’t totally forgotten, Neither had Don, and he had been doing some sleuthing.

“I can’t prove for sure who your email hoaxster is, but I think I know, he remarked as they sipped their soup.”

“Who?” Erica asked.

“Your teammate Linda – using a connection at her cousin’s house so that it can’t be easily traced back,” theorized Doin

“What?” exclaimed the startled Erica, “How did you come to that conclusion?”

“A friend of mine over at the university knows how to tracks hackers. The same principals apply to emails. We traced all three emails back to a common Comcast hub – but Comcast doesn’t service this area. So it seemed like a dead end. But then an announcement sent by Linda’s brother Walter for the Spanish Club came out; in it he casually mentioned he was composing it from his cousin’s house by plugging in his notebook. Now that cousin lives half – a county away, over in Comcast cable territory. We traced it and bingo, same hub. Of course, all that proves for sure is a possibility; anyone with access to any machine linked to that Comcast hub is equally possible - but the coincidence is striking.”

“But why?” stammered Erica

“Two for one – if people believed the emails then Kimberly is off from Cheer permanently and Ashley gets to nominate the successor, who would possibly be Linda. If they suspected you then all the better because neither Ashley or Kim would have any other choice. At least that makes sense to me,” said Don

“So much intrigue! Don, you know that despite my nickname I’m really not a ditz and I don’t need cheer drama to be happy. I was hoping being in cheer would get me with a guy, and I kind of like what’s happening with you, big fella. The goodies you’re enjoying are of more interest to me than that kind of drama,” Erica said ss she reached over and stroked his forearm.

“I sort of figured that. And by the way, I did get a new pair of trousers to accommodate your efforts,” Don noted as he moved from his empty soup bowl to the fish.

”Well you need to keep up the effort and catch me, cause I‘ve put on a few too. I really hope you’re bigger than me by the end of summer.” she smiled

“If I keep eating like I have been that’s possible – I’ll be over 170, which with my height wouldn’t be bad,” Don said pensively.

Erica bit her lip. She knew she wasn’t yet over 150, but unless her own gain slowed she too could be past 170 by September. That would definitely be too much for cheer and Linda, assuming she was guilty, might get her desire by default. Actually it didn’t seem to matter that much. She was enjoying Tony Romans atmosphere and her luscious supper. But there was a question she needed to address.,

“Umm – let me ask you something,” Erica said. “I’m not predicting it will happen, but what if I get up to non-cheerleader proportions, would that make a difference to you?”

Don looked sat her and smiled, “Yes, it would make a big difference. We could have more time together since you wouldn’t be at practices. And then you’d get me up to where you want for sure!”

The dinner proceeded to its conclusion and neither felt like dessert. They went home stuffed, Don had dropped his bombshell and now needed to wait and see how Erica would handle it.

Meanwhile with the new semester the cheerleading team switched over to basketball. The routines were less demanding, coming only for infrequent time outs and not involving pyramids and the like. Erica took Ashley aside and told her of her suspicions; she was amazed to find hast Ashley had wondered the same thing.

“What do you want me to do? Confront her, then bounce her? I can understand why you might want to –especially if she confesses,” Ashley asked.

Erica paused. “No, at the time I was upset but its history and not being continued. Now it doesn’t matter – and who would we replace her with at this late date? But at some point I’d like to find out why.”

“Agree. I think you’re very wise for a Junior,” smiled Ashley. “Try for awhile to get close to her, maybe she’ll get enough guilt to come forward; if not, I’ll confront her.

Over the next couple of weeks Erica continued plying Don with after school treats such as apple crisp with ice cream and pumpkin pie with Kool Whip and cinnamon rolls with milk, Carmel brownies, cherry cobblers and the like. Every day it seemed featured a new goodie.

His body was responding nicely. He’d twice had to let t out his belt a notch and then bought some new trousers. But also noticeable was the impact on Erica’s posterior and thighs. As a result her shorter tops no longer covered her waistband. Her plumpening belly and small developing love handles were plainly visible for all to see.

Don loved this. It fit in with the chunky boar look Ashley and her friends were promoting as a sort of latest fad. He made sure to compliment her on her se look and it gave her a confident air even at lunch as she now openly ate dessert virtually every day. One teacher commented on the exposure and she feigned a crestfallen look

“Yeah, it didn’t use to show. Guess I’ve picked up dome weight,” Erica remarked. But inwardly she had no doubts or regrets. At least 20 others on campus had exposed guts bigger than hers – what were they going to do? Outlaw bare midriffs over a certain size on campus?

Erica readily adapted to the new reality, even buying a new outfit and wetsuit for the swim team, whose season was about to start. This didn’t prevent a little teasing from another team member as she caught her devouring an oversize almond Joy candy bar before practice “Hey Erica, getting a little extra booty there I see.”

Erica was ready. “Not that it matters, but haven’t you read your papers? A little fat can be good for a swimmer. Too little weight hikes frontal drag in the water according to a University of Miami study.”

“You mean you’re going to deliberately stay chunky,” responded her classmate, mouth agape.

“We’ll see how I do in practice – but its not a given that thin is in for swimmers. I can tell you that my boyfriend likes my added curves and I’ve no desire to diet,” Erica said as she took another bite out of her bar.

“OK, so what’s with the wet suit?”

“Bottom line, it makes me faster in the water. The suit covers the torso and legs but not the head, shifting my centre of buoyancy toward the feet and putting me in a more horizontal position, This further reduces the frontal surface area which makes direct contact with the water. With wet suits, I‘m simply more streamlined.

“Duh, alright, So then you’ll be faster?

“In freestyle yes, although research says my bun is too big for the backstroke, so that’s not going to be helpful,” Erica said, finishing off the last of her candy bar.
.
Once in the water Erica’s constant cheerleading exercising asserted itself. Fat or not she had plenty of muscle and easily out distanced everyone.

Don for his part loved indulging Erica’s new gourmand appetite as well as his own. On Saturday before noon he took her to a local food court Round Robin to share a Rajin Cajun chicken burger (deep fried chicken smothered in buffalo sauce, topped with pepper jack cheese) with steak fries. Then they went to the next door Coldstone’s where they each had a whole Love It sized cake batter ice cream filled with M&M's and gummi bears. She ate every bite and would have had some of his except that he’d finished it off first.

That night they went to a privately hosted game night with pizza, chicken wings, salads soda and of course ice cream. Erica contentedly grazed all evening, consuming four pizza slices, an equal number of chicken wings, potato and macaroni salads, and two huge bowls of ice cream. One of her classmates shook her head, noting the two large love handles forming on either side of her torso.

On Sunday morning the binge, for that is the only fair thing to call it, continued. She had her usual pancakes, eggs and sausage for breakfast before Don picked her up. Then she offered to buy him some Kripy Kreme pastries to tide him over until lunch since he’d failed to have breakfast. He ate half of them, but she got a Krispy Kreme original glazed doughnut, a divine powdered doughnut with strawberry filling, and a custard filled puff. This was followed at lunch by a crisp burrito with regular mexi-fries and two tacos.

She was truly as her Aunt Rachel had said, becoming a pudgy princess. But to her the important news as she looked in the mirror towards the endof February and saw her increasingly fleshy cheeks and underchin was that Don was developing a real belly and butt.

For four weeks she’d made a point of being nice to Linda, watching to see her reaction. The junior cheerleader was never rude to her fellow underclassman, but seemed a bit withdrawn. She looked longingly at lunch as Erica would devour a pizza or cheeseburger, sometimes with hot chocolate and an apple fritter chaser. Erica was constantly sharing with Don, trying successfully to get him to out eat her but still having more than Linda – who never seemed to eat anything more than a salad or mini-portion..

Finally one day when Ashley had the team together after school at a neighborhood taco café there was a featured special of tilapia taco with pineapple-cilantro black beans and rice. Linda as usual just had one while everyone else was having at lest two.

“Come on,” said Erica, “have another – its free and soooo good.”

“Good for you and Miss Perfect, maybe – but you’ve both got what you want. You’re just patronizing me ‘cause I’m poor with no boyfriend.” Linda said softly, but Ashley heard. Rosa and Amber were preoccupied refilling their sodas and hadn’t noticed.

Quietly Ashley turned to Linda and confronted her. “Is that why you starve yourself, reject others and send emails using other’s names? Because you don’t have money or a boyfriend?”

Linda was startled, even more so when Rosa, suspecting what was going on, pulled Amber away,

“Oh yes, Erica and I know those emails came from a Comcast site and that you have a notebook you use at your cousins. But we’ve been hoping you’d become a friend and explain why you did it. We’re not mad – the silliness hurt no one, but it tells us you’re hurting. Now what’s going on?”

“Who else knows?” she trembled.

“Can’t say for sure – the guys figured it out. But no one wants to report it. We want to know why,” the team captain said.

“You’re not bouncing me?” Linda said.

“We’ve known for a month,” Erica said. “Why would we do it now with only a few weeks to go and Kim possibly coming back? You’d be pushed back to JV automatically – so why create a sandal?’

Janet’s eyes welled up with tears. “I knew that – and wanted so much not to have to go back down. I have parents that would beat me if I weighed what you two do – and they want me to win honors. Cheer is what I’m good at, not debate or swimming like you two.”

“You are so driven by fear and self-limitation. Let me let you in on a secret. Kim’s thinking of not even coming back – so what do you think about that if it happens?” stated Ashley.

“What?” exclaimed Erica, “Why>”

“She’ll explain herself if it happens I’m sure . All I know is that its what her boyfriend Brian thinks best and she’s thinking about it. Meanwhile I‘m happy with the team we have and there may be some surprises after the end of March. But Linda, no more shenanigans, OK?”

Linda nodded. “And I don’t have to eat pizza and macaroni till I pop as a penalty? I thought you guys would be sooo mad you’d make me eat until I was huge!”

Ashley shook her head. “this team is called the Boers – we’re not small. But those of who eat do it because it tastes good; we’re in better condition than a lot of people expect. Now, do I have your pledge to behave?”

“Yes, captain”

Erica couldn’t wait to get on her cell and tell Don he had been right – and then ask what he knew about Kimberly. She was intrigued by his reply.

“Rumor has it that Kim is listening to Brian; she knows that she was used to hurt Ashley. She is not wanting to diet or be used as a tool anymore. So anything is possible, but like Ashley says, its her choice.”
